benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/paymentMethods/refresh - Refresh account payment methods

covered: Valid PUT request coverage: TC01–TC06 verify successful refresh with required and parameterized inputs (pluginName, pluginProperty) and optional headers.
Non-Existing Resource: TC09 guards 404 for non-existent account.
Authorization/Authentication: TC10 covers missing X-Killbill-CreatedBy header; TC15 covers unauthorized access scenarios.
Input validation and error cases: TC08 (invalid accountId format), TC11 (unsupported pluginName), TC12 (malformed pluginProperty).
Security tests: TC16 (SQL injection) and TC17 (XSS) ensure input is not executed or rendered unsafely.
External dependencies/integration: TC13 (external gateway down) and TC25 (plugin service unavailable) cover downstream failures.
Timeouts and degraded performance: TC20 (timeout/504) and TC29 (degraded performance) assess resilience under slow operations.
Data integrity and regression: TC26 (data consistency after refresh), TC21 (encoding regression), TC22 (backward compatibility).

Edge cases and large input handling: TC07 (many pluginProperty values), TC18 (extra query parameters), TC19 (very large accountId), TC24 (large pluginProperty payloads), TC28 (partially populated database) and TC27 (empty database) cover robustness across data scenarios.
Concurrency: TC23 validates handling of multiple concurrent refresh requests.
gaps: Caching behavior and caching headers (ETag/Cache-Control) for PUT are not tested.
Rate limiting/throttling scenarios are not explicitly tested beyond concurrent requests.
403 Forbidden boundary (insufficient privileges) is not explicitly tested (only 401 shown).
Pagination is not applicable to this endpoint and not tested (PUT typically does not paginate).
Further edge-case validation for pluginName encoding/special characters could be expanded.
recommendations: Add tests for caching headers (ETag/Cache-Control) on PUT if caching is expected for this endpoint.
Introduce rate-limiting/throttling tests (e.g., burst of refresh requests, 429/503 behavior).
Add 403 Forbidden test to cover insufficient privileges/scope scenarios.
Expand pluginName edge-case validation (special characters, whitespace, length).
Conduct additional thorough concurrency/stress testing with latency measurements and stability checks.
